intro: Panicum subeglume, commonly known as slender panicgrass, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. It is often used in ecological restoration due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
